meanings.definition: The act of taking action in advance to deal with an expected difficulty or problem.
meanings.sent1: Her proactions in preparing for the storm saved her from any damage to her house.
meanings.sent2: The company's proactions in implementing safety measures prevented any accidents.
meanings.sent3: His proactions in stocking up on snacks before the movie night were greatly appreciated by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The proactions taken by the firefighters ensured that the forest fire was quickly contained.
meanings.sent5: The proactions of wearing a helmet while biking can prevent serious head injuries.

meanings.definition: The act of initiating an action or response.
meanings.sent1: The proactions of the team leader inspired everyone to work harder.
meanings.sent2: His proactions in organizing the event made it a great success.
meanings.sent3: The proactions of the cat to catch the mouse were both swift and stealthy.
meanings.sent4: The proactions of the teacher in encouraging students led to improved performance.
meanings.sent5: The proactions of the detective in solving the case were commendable.
